name: Author Disambiguation: Signatures worth it
description:
The objective is to disambiguate two *signatures*. A signature can be

* a more-or-less-full name (i.e some combinaison of firstname, middle name and lastname)
	```"Carlos Ray Norris", "Carlos Norris", "Carlos-Ray Norris"```
* with or without upper cases, accents and punctuation
	```"carlos ray norris", u"Carlòs Ray Norris", "Carlos!", "Norris? carlos!"```
* a consequent number of corresponding initials (initials should be followed by a space, a dot or a dash)
	```"C R Norris", "C-R N", "C.R N.", "Carlos-Ray N."```
* a various mix of the above...
* order of the mixed arguments shoult not matter


The function ```could_be``` is given two *signatures* and should return
```True``` if they might belong to the same author. 

Therefore, all the given examples below should match:

```python
def test_success():
	synonyms = ("Carlos Ray Norris", "Carlos Norris", "Carlos-Ray Norris",
		"carlos ray norris", u"Carlòs Ray Norris", "Carlos!", "Norris? Carlos!", 
		"Carlos. Ray; Norris,", "Carlos:Ray Norris",
		"C N", "C-R N", "C.R N.")
	for (one, another) in permutations(synonyms, 2):
		assert could_be(one, another) # -> True
```

Beware that you could also match "Chuck Norris" with "C Norris" or "C N"
but not with "Carlos Norris". 

Obviously (?) they are not the same person.

When accents comes into the game, they will enter through UTF-8 unicodes.

Here are few examples of signatures that do not match:

```python
def test_ko():
	various = ("Carlos Norris", "Carlos Ray", "Ray Norris", "Chuck", 
		"Dave Norris", "L. N.", "C. Raymond Norris", "")
	for (one, another) in permutations(various, 2):
		assert not could_be(one, another) # -> False
```

As an ending note, ```could_be``` should be symmetrical, i.e results for
```could_be(A, B)``` must be identical to ```could_be(B, A)```

You might want to warm up with the two other puzzles from the serie "Author Disambiguation"

* [To the point](https://www.codewars.com/kata/author-disambiguation-to-the-point), rather simple
* [A name is a Name](https://www.codewars.com/kata/author-disambiguation-a-name-is-a-name), more permissive
